intro: Moricandia moricandioides subsp. baetica, commonly known as the Baetican sand mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often covered with fine hairs. This subspecies is adapted to arid and coastal environments, showcasing resilience to saline and drought conditions.
